course_title: Advanced Topics in Film and Media Studies: Criticism and Critique
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course examines the nature of criticism and its relation to the concept of critique, including recent debates over calls for a "post-critical" approach to the humanities, controversies over critical race theory, and the implication of critical theory in the rise of "post-truth" politics and media. Weekly screenings required.
course_description: This course is designed to give advanced students the opportunity to investigate intensively a specialized topic in film and media studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 301 or FILM 301W or FILM 302 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
